EDUCATIONAL TELEVISION STATIONS
NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF EDUCATIONAL BROADCASTERS
PHONE: 667-6000 • 1346 CONNECTICUT AVENUE • WASHINGTON, D.C. 20036
Office of the Executive Director February 17, 1969
A division of
MEMORANDUM
To: Executive Staff
From: Chalmers H. Marquis
Re: Interconnection meeting. Ford Foundation,
February 13, 1969
The meeting was chaired by Ward Chamberlin, CPB with Fred
Friendly, Dave Davis and David Ginsburg, Ford Foundation,
Jerry Appy, NET, Don Quayle, CPB , Jerry Slater, NET-
PBL and myself.
A number of points were made which I will report to you here:
1. Pre-emptions have been reduced substantially in the
past ten days and presuming the present circumstances
continue, the situation looks good.
2. The stations agree that either this situation must remain
in this improved condition or it should be abandoned.
3. We endorsed a priority that all stations in the country
as soon as reasonable should be connected - thereby
adding the dozen or so stations not now interconnected,
and putting lines in to those dozen or so additionally that
are now taking programs off the air.
4. In order to look at the full system, we proposed, we must
have the AT&T proposal due to the FCC and us last November
15th and not yet released by AT&T. We will continue to seek
it.
5. Our immediate objectives are these:
a. Maintenance of the current system, including
outstanding national programming, 4, 5 nights.
